sentence.text: ï»¿A non-consanguineous 31-year-old couple (II-1 and II-2) was referred to the Jikei University Hospital with a neonate at 13 weeks of gestation with severe fetal hydrops (III-2) (Figure 1a).
They had a previous pregnancy in which the fetus had a similar lethal phenotype (III-1).
Fetal ultrasound imaging of III-1 revealed severe limb shortening and fetal hydrops (Figure 2a,b).
At 16 weeks of gestation, intrauterine fetal death was confirmed.
Although autopsy imaging was performed after delivery, a definitive clinical diagnosis was not achieved (Figure 2c,d).
Since similar lethal malformations were detected in III-1 and III-2, an inherited autosomal recessive bone disorder was suspected.
Following genetic counseling, the couple agreed to undergo detailed molecular genetic analysis.
